186033740.review: I had this game sitting in my library for quite some time and the other day while recovering from being sick I decided to give it a go finally. It's a shame it took me this long to finally play it, because this game is fantastic. The world of the Talos station is incredible and fully realized in Arkane's art style. It feels closer to a Resident Evil style game with many puzzles, locked doors and hidden goodies to discover. Combat is largely "ok" and the main thing I had to get over was the lack of an ADS feature when holding guns, but once you get used to it, it's fine. The characters here are all pretty great and provide really good backstories and a lot of the background can be found in terminals through reading emails. The story feels predictable at first, but they throw enough twists and turns that make you truly think about the final choices towards the end. I also love how the game gives you many tools and choices throughout, so the playthroughs can differ. Overall, I thoroughly recommend this game.

185873276.review: Oddly took me three attempts over three years before it made "click". Getting into Prey and it's complex and varied gameplay can be though, esp. if you don't have a lot of time to spend on video games. But once you get past the somewhat clunky and overwhelming beginning, the immersive part kicks in and the game starts to make a lot of fun. Gameplay is fun and varied, the atmosphere is greate, the Talos station is a great setting and even the side quests are all enjoyable. The only minor issue is that navigation can be a bit confusing and the fact that you spend a lot of time back tracking, esp, when doing all the side quests. But none of that is actually a big deal and I had a blast finishing this incl. almost all side quests. There aren't many games similar to this (esp. outside of what Arkane did), so this is indeed something special. Let's hope Arkane returns to the space sci-fi setting, and let's hope they're not forced to make it a game in the Prey universe but instead have them go their own creative way.

185778277.review:
The only thing I regret about this game is not having played it sooner, I wish I could fully manifest how much I love this game, to me, it feels like one of the most innovative, immersive, and fun to play game I have played in 2024, and I would even say in my whole life, around every corner the game presented me a new mechanic, a new idea to play with, and I was always in awe at the raw creativity the game had to offer. Talos one with all its different areas is full of things to discover, treasures to find, ways to toy with the environment, here and there are notes, emails and letters that retail through different point of views the timeline of events, and you have to piece it all together to fully understand all that happened.

The game has some small issues still, the sound mixing is a bit iffy and the dialogs cut each other sometimes, at least in the dub I got, but nothing too big to worry about. I sometimes get pessimist about the modern gaming industry and I feel like nothing new and exciting ever gets released, It's those type of games that remind me why I love video games in the first place, to me, this is a classic and I wish it got the recognition it deserved at the time of its release, I feel like I can't say more, I just urge you to play this game, have fun !

185722012.review:
Prey. Мой первый иммерсив сим. Восторг, который я испытывал во время прохождения, сложно описать словами. Но я, все же, постараюсь это сделать. Начну с далека. Лет десять тому назад, я уже пытался попробовать себя в этом жанре, а именно в серии игр Dishonored. И тогда, в силу отсутствия у меня здравого смысла, скила прохождения нелинейных игр или обыкновенного чувства вкуса, я забросил данный жанр в самый глубокий ящик и не имел ни желания, ни смелости его оттуда выковыривать. Но вот я уже созревший ум, наверное, сижу над своей библиотекой стим и не знаю во что я хочу поиграть. Недолго думая, решаю сыграть в лотерею. Запускаю колесо рандома, и выигрываю джек-пот, о котором тогда еще не догадываюсь. Но давайте и о самой игре.

	Сюжет. На первый взгляд, незатейливая история про борьбу человека с неизвестной инопланетной субстанцией. Многого от истории не ожидаешь. Правда? Тогда вашему удивлению, также, как и моему, не будет предела. А удивляться есть чему, казалось на первый взгляд мелочь, а подчеркивает те или иные события на станции. Тут записку прочитал о взаимоотношениях между персоналом, то электронное письмо, написанное несколько дней назад, ныне уже трупом, который забился в углу своего кабинета. От этого веришь, что станция жива, когда-то была жива. По этой причине общаться и стараться помочь последним крупицам выживших становится еще интереснее. А локальная история каждого, может пронять и на печаль, и на сострадания, и на заботу. Я любитель закрыть игру на 100%, поэтому пробегал игру не один раз. Каждый раз игра генерировала разные ситуации, от чего, все три прохождения чувствовались уникальными и разнообразными. В самом начале, еще в обучении мы должны были пройти тест. Это реальный тест, в нашем мире он тоже существует и называется “Проблема вагонетки”. И лишь спустя три прохождения я понял, что наше тестирование заканчивается только после титров. И самое удивительное, что игра тестит не персонажа, а нас игрока. Игра незаметно проверяла все наши действия, что б понять, какое из трех начал главного героя предлагаемых игрой, выберет игрок. Альтруистическое, эгоистическое или утилитарное. И каждая концовка напрямую показывает нам, какие последствия понесут наши действия. Ведь под вагонетку ми можем как спрыгнуть сами, так и столкнуть толстяка.

	Гейплей. Хорошая история, замаскированная в детали, это конечно хорошо. Но ни для кого не секрет, что для большинства игроков гейплей важен не меньше. Как дела обстоят тут? Ну… Такого разнообразия преодоления тех или иных препятствий, на своей игровой карьере, я не припомню ни в одной другой игре. Где еще что б попасть в комнату, у тебя есть от одного до пяти вариантов решения данной задачи. Прокачался в хакера, взломай замок. Прокачался в умения тифона, превратись в мелкий объект и проскользни в щель. Не качал способности вообще, найди ключ карту или залезь по стене с помощью Гипс-пушки в вентиляционный люк, а можешь тупо разбить стекло и активировать дверь выстрелом специального оружия по кнопке. Фух, и это еще не все возможности. Не везде так, но таких ситуаций множество. Присутствует, как и огнестрельное вооружение для отстрела бесформенных тварей, так и возможность пройти почти всех супостатов по стелсу. Стрельба немного топорная, правда если играть на сложности выше обычной ты сто раз подумаешь, прежде чем пальнуть во врага. Еще приятно удивил факт, что почти все коды и по моим ощущением некоторые предметы рандомны. Плюс к реиграбельности. Простыми словами, почти гейплейная утопия. Ключевое слово, почти.

	Атмосфера и мир. Если атмосфера тебя заволакивает после первого часа прохождения, то вот в устройстве мира и его проверке на “живость” приходится немного разобраться. Но как я уже писал выше, каждое письмо, каждая записка, каждый труп, который ты находишь и места в где они умерли, рассказывают историю. Почти безмолвно раскрывают и влюбляют тебя в мир космической станции. Большие помещения наводят ужас и грозят опасными врагами, а мелкие пространства дарят чувство дискомфорта и страха, что ты не сможешь в случае чего дать деру. Огромную опасность приносят тифоны класса мимик, они способны превратиться в любой предмет на станции. Нападение этой опасной твари, стоит ожидать в любой момент. Играя на высоких сложностях, игра дарит тебе состояние паники. С одного боку состояние прекрасное для игрового экспириенса, но в то же время ты постоянно оборачиваешься и слышишь шорохи у себя в комнате. Степень высшей паранойи начинает все чаще посещать твои мысли. А как писал один из моих любимых фантастов Филип Киндред Дик, –“Высшая степень паранойи – это не когда все против тебя, это когда всё против тебя”.

	Музыкальное сопровождение на высоте, каждый стук и шорох не оставит тебя безразличным. Услышав шаги, ты невольно прислушаешься к ним и поймешь, как далеко враг от тебя. Нажимая на всевозможные терминалы и кнопки, ты слышишь такой звук, какой ожидал. Прям раздражающих звуком я не припоминаю. Приятный и в некоторой мере успокаивающий эмбиент. Неплохой вступительный ролик с около синтвей-стайл композицией. Особо и придраться не к чему.

	Итог. Как мой первый опыт в иммерсивы, это прекрасно. Мнение немного предвзято, всё-таки я на положительных эмоциях. Но если кто спросит меня о Prey, я игру буду только нахваливать. Да. Игра не идеальная, идеальных игр в принципе не существует. Но думаю, пройдя игру, многие согласятся. Творение французской студии, достойное времени и денег, потраченных на нее. 

	На этом спасибо. Играем в хорошие игры и не теряемся! А, и еще… смотрите что берете в руки…

185707383.review:
„System Shock”, „BioShock” oraz maleńka nutka “Half-Life’a”. Tak mógłbym opisać swoje doświadczenia po ukończeniu rozgrywki, która zajęła mi na najwyższym poziomie trudności jakieś 20 godzin. Głupi byłem, żem nie sprawdził osiągnięć, bowiem na koniec niedane mi było uświadczyć standardowej nagrody za katorgę na koszmarnej trudności. Nic to, odkuje sobie przy kolejnym przejściu, grając na trybie przygody. Dodam jedynie, że gra jest naprawdę prosta niezależnie od wybranego poziomu. Wystarczy się jeno wczuć w rozgrywkę i chomikować zapasy na trudne chwile, a potem okazuje się, że już nie ma gdzie apteczek zmieścić.

‘Prey is an immersive sim. A bit of actioner, a bit of RPG, a bit of what-have-you, depending on your play style. In this field, the game is really, really good, offering many solutions to exploration problems. However, I have to admit that I was still most impressed by the beginning and the ending. Let's lean into the former!

The year is 2032 in an alternative history. Here, the Cold War was not so frosty and JFK survived the attempt on his life. The superpowers have seized the opportunity to put aside military matters to focus on space conquest. State projects, however, have a certain tendency to ... generate problems. This therefore creates an opportunity for private companies and corporations. One of these was TranStar. A large conglomerate involved in biotechnology, military and aerospace. They buy up the space station Talos I, where we will spend the next few hours as Morgan Yu (gender optional). Very quickly, the player realises that something is wrong and that the whole world around him is... Aaa! I won't tell you, because, as I already mentioned, it was this initial plot twist that dragged me to discover the whole mystery. All I will say is that there was an Incident on the station, and we will be forced to solve this problem in a way that is in accordance with our conscience ;)

It's nice when the creators wrap up an interesting concept with a claw of freedom of play. It's a little worse when pretty packaging and delectable chocolate only stimulate an appetite for the filling, and this turns out to be... normal? I'd like to be a little upset, although in truth, I have nothing to be upset about, as the gameplay was as correct as possible, and its little elements added to the fun.

The initial paranoia that you are about to be attacked by a first aid kit that is lying innocently waiting for someone to pick it up. Or a cup! Or a chair! Brr! In this respect, Arkane has done an excellent job. It's only after a while that the spell wears off and we are confronted with a multitude of repetitive enemies, as well as slightly annoying backtracking. Something that could have been forgiven in ‘System Shock’, because that production was a pioneer, unfortunately does not work this 30 years later. Okay, some elements have been added to add variety to the exploration, such as time limits or spamming more and more enemies. Nonetheless, this can sometimes become a healthy annoyance. Also, despite 7 years since the release (seriously :|?), there are still some bugs. It cost me an hour cut out of my life, and I hate wasting time in this way, so here - a gutsy minus.

But, but, he seems to be whining and wrote something about a second attempt! That's right! The ending! Arakne has served us an extremely interesting vision. I always try to play to my conscience first and save whoever I can (at least I got an achivment for that), so now it's time for a light speedrun in the style of a maniacal killer of everything and everyone. What the hell!

Graphically and musically... cool. Not hot or cold. Usually when I'm writing these reviews, I play the soundtrack from a given game and only the track ‘Everything Is Going to Be Okay’ seems to evoke more positive emotions in me. Such a cool retro synthwave from the intro (did I say the beginning was the best?).

All in all, I highly recommend it, because it's a really cool game for cracking up and having fun. Maybe a little too long? It's also a little short on potential, but I hope that one day we'll get something more RPG-like in this fascinating vision of our modern history.

185592271.review:
Mecánicas aburridas y dirección artística olvidable. La premisa de ser un simple sujeto atrapado en un lugar lleno de pesadillas ha sido llevada a cabo con gran éxito en varias ocasiones -véase Half-Life y Dead Space-, y yo creía que Prey apuntaba a ser algo parecido... hasta que lo jugué.
Prey se jacta de otorgar completa libertad al jugador en cuanto a como quiere actuar a bordo de la nave, pero esto realmente se resume a un limitado abanico de armas para elegir y algunos caminos prefijados que seguir en base a las decisiones que tomas respecto al puñado de personajes humanos y robóticos hablantes que te encuentras -los cuales sinceramente no me evocaron ningún sentimiento más allá de leve simpatía-. 
Realmente podría justificarse una trama tan sencilla con personajes tan simplones y poco carismáticos si al menos los enemigos y el escenario fueran únicos y geniales de ver, pero -como podrás imaginar- esto tampoco es así. Solamente están las arañas que se convierten en objetos, distintas variaciones elementales del mismo enemigo humanoide, y algunas masas flotantes que hacen uno que otro truco de magia. 
Para ser supuestamente el eje principal del juego, realmente dejan mucho que desear.
La nave Talos-1 es también simplona y olvidable -que sorpresa, no?-, con una mezcla entre tecnología moderna y cultura estadounidense espacial de la década de los 50 que llega a sentirse molesta a la vista tras una exposición prolongada. 
Nada que decir sobre el gameplay más que es lo mismo que Dishonored, pero con armas de fuego. Nada sobresaliente.
En conclusión, Prey es un juego medianamente interesante, pero con una dirección artística tan sencillamente aburrida y plana, con tan poca personalidad propia, y que me dejó sensaciones tan tibias al momento de terminarlo que no puedo hacer otra cosa más que NO RECOMENDARLO y decirte que -en lugar de comprar esto- te vayas a jugar Alien Isolation -si te gusta el terror en el espacio-, o Half-Life si es que quieres ser un científico sobreviviente y abrirte paso a través de una instalación secreta matando a decenas de militares y alienígenas como Gabe Newell -el dios del gaming- manda.

185583219.review:
Just like Deus Ex, I once started this game, played for 30 minutes and then didn't touch it again.
And just like Deus Ex, I one day started it again and got completely lost in this prime example of peak game design.

I will not spoil anything. I think every single bit of information about this game is worth being experienced firsthand instead of being told. But games like this make me weep for how dead the genre of immersive sims is, for its story, characters, locations, themes and worldbuilding really sucked me in.

Тут був мій прорахунок, бо я протягом усієї не використовував шоковий пістолет і тільки під кінець від браку набоїв зрозумів, що він імба в поєднанні з іншою зброєю.

👉Мені не сподобалось що гра намагається бути виживачем. Ну як "намагається" вона він і є. До прикладу той самий стелс. Він абсолютно безкорисний на початку і навіть на середині гри. Його використання обмежується тим що ти просто уникаєш ворога, бо вбити когось в стелсі одним пострілом неможливо, а ворог помічає тебе дуже швидко.

Звісно якщо ви граєте на якійсь там середній складності, або взагалі на складності сюжет для вас не буде жодних проблем, але якщо ви граєте на високій буквально кожна сутичка з ворогом (за виключенням звичайних міміків) це справжній виклик до того ж повторний спавн ворогів просто вбиває відчуття якогось прогресу.
👉 Ще одна дурість. В грі є моб котрий атакує електро харчуванням. Уявімо ситуацію - ти розставив купу турелей на локації покидаєш її у справах повертаєшся і всі турелі, або вимкнуті або знищені тільки, тому що там заспавнився цей ворог. Тобто ніякого умовного бою між ними навіть не відбулось він просто автоматично своєю присутністю вимикає всі турелі. І це не якийсь там рідкий ворог. Після середини гри він зустрічається доволі часто. Короче турелі смокчуть.
👉ЛАБІРИНТИ. Локації дуже заплутані. Справа не просто в жанрі Immersive sim який дає гравцю неймовірну варіативність проходження локацій річ у, тому що локації в цій грі  реалізовані окремо до того ж в одній локації може бути купа вертикальних рівнів з заплутаним переходом між ними. 
👉Я не перебільшу якщо скажу, що більшу частину часу гравець витрачає на пересування між  локаціями між цими клятими екранами завантаження. 
👉До цього можна додати мітки квестів, наприклад - я обирав квест, а мітка показує не на окремі проходи які ведуть до кінцевого виходу з локації, а одразу на вихід з локації виходить так що ти дивишся в кляту стелю на цю кляту мітку і ламаєш собі мозок як туди потрапити це просто біль для людей з топографічним кретинізмом. 
Так, якби кожен прохід був відмічений це могло б вбити атмосферу коли ти точно знаєш куди йти, але в чому була проблема реалізувати мітки для основних проходів, або зробити так що коли гравець пройшов локацію і, наприклад повернувся до неї мітки показують на проходи в яких гравець вже був це ж не складно реалізувати.

👉 Висновок. Дуже амбітна, та велика гра як на гру від аркейн. Якщо дізоноред 2 проходився ну годин за 17 з доп контентом, то прей цілих 30 не в останню чергу завдяки підходу до локацій.

185501971.review:
First of all, one of the most iconic and memorable video game opening that I've experienced, up there with one of my other favorite, Bioshock Infinite. Simply beautiful.

Game wise, I like the non-linear and character building based on levels, you can choose skills that suits your playstyle as you level up, or try something completely different. As a gun totting mercenary, or a Mage with alien powers, or just a sneakyboi to sneak past the encounters at all.

Please note that this is an Immersive Sim genre, and not a Call of Duty linear shoot-em-up. At times you will find yourself ventured into an extremely powerful enemy, which means that is not somewhere you need to be, which means you should come back later or otherwise if you are able to defeat/outsmart them with your gaming skills. There is multiple ways to get pass enemies, sneak pass them, blow their heads straight on with your abilities. New gamers that came from linear shooters might not be aware of this as there are many possible solutions to this semi-open world problems, the game won't give you solutions, but you have many creative solutions to come up with, don't give up just yet with a powerful enemy, try something else.

It is overall a great game, I just hope that there were a few more enemy types, for example, there were some enemies with unique names, [spoiler] supposedly some crew-turned alien [/spoiler],
but they behave not too different at all from the usual encounters except for maybe larger health bar. Adding some unique elements to these named enemies would give the game more spice for players to plan out their execution to take them down and possibly lore for each Transtar employee before they met their demise.

That being said, I'd really love to see a sequel to this.

185445114.review:
[h1]类型[/h1]
第一人称射击，剧情

[h1]游戏内容[/h1]
扮演“摩根·余[spoiler]的异星生物[/spoiler]”，调查转星集团的塔洛斯一号宇宙飞船上发生的外星生物事件。
可以使用扳手、霰弹枪、手枪、凝固枪（GLOO）、激光枪、电击枪作为武器，配有一些不同功能的投掷炸弹，还可以使用灵异能力进行不同种类的攻击。
捡垃圾升级武器和能力。

[h1]剧情概述[/h1]
[spoiler]艾利克斯·余尝试为外星生物注入人性以进行合作，他将自己弟弟/妹妹（玩家自选主角性别）摩根·余的记忆输入给一只异星生物，玩家扮演这只异星摩根，在被异星生物入侵的塔洛斯一号飞船上尝试拯救地球。
游戏甫一开始进行的记忆困在同一天的奇怪测试，就是在试验玩家操作的异星生物摩根是否可以正常扮演人类，脱离灵异能力。最终结局不论玩家是选择炸毁塔洛斯一号以避免外星生物以其作为跳板占领地球，还是选择安装极波发射器用技术的手段阻止外星生物占领地球，最终都会在艾利克斯的模拟试验中醒来，看到地球已经被占领的画面，并选择是否与艾利克斯合作，成为人类和异星生物之间的桥梁。实际上，到最终，玩家也不知道地球是否真的被占领了？塔洛斯一号上发生的到底是一个编造的故事还是真实存在的？摩根·余到底是不是真实存在的人？留给人许多遐想。[/spoiler]

[h1]感想[/h1]
游戏开场时，被困在同一天的剧情很吸引人，但之后就进入了无限的刷怪、打怪、跑地图、捡垃圾、读邮件，直到结尾或者十二月支线揭示真相才迎来另一个剧情高潮。虽然也有支线故事，但考虑到游戏的总时长，总体上无法掩盖剧情稍弱的短板。虽然结局有点新意，但实在戛然而止，没有给人留下回味无穷和震撼的感觉。总体来说本作一般般推荐。

185311854.review:
当初在epic上面领的游戏本体，一口气玩了60小时通关，意犹未尽，为了dlc重新买了一次，又玩了20小时。dlc通关后便没有再打开，写这篇评论时已经是两年后了，但这游戏一直在我的游戏推荐名单里面。

这游戏最吸引我的点是美术设计风格，整个塔洛斯一号空间站的设计可以说正是我所想象的近现代科幻应有的样子，清爽、整洁、优雅。充足的面积使得空间站规划的井井有条，而不是现代航天那样为了尽可能压缩空间而紧凑排列。空间站内不同功能区的风格也有很大差异，能很好的体现出该区域所承担的职责，生活区温暖、舒适，办公区严肃、整洁等等。你能透过这些设计体验到空间站工作人员平时的上下班轨迹，在哪里聚会聊天，在哪里睡觉休息，整个塔洛斯一号空间站就如同一个微型城市一般，你能感受到曾经的生活气息。

这游戏的剧情也是吸引我玩下去的主要因素之一，（涉及剧透）[spoiler] 尤其是开场的一扳手，击碎现实与虚幻隔层的那一瞬间，演出真是精妙至极。 [/spoiler]游戏流程中也有很多剧情信息是藏在诸如员工的电脑邮件里面这种小角落，也是给了玩家自主选择的权力。你对剧情不太关心，可以直接跑主线，体验枪械与异能的战斗环节，一样也能看懂剧情在讲什么；如果你像我一样喜欢这些边边角角的小细节，就能体验到这些工作人员平时的日常生活，人与人之间的联系，今天又发生了什么新鲜事，仿佛他们是有血有肉活生生的人。dlc的剧情也很棒，看着好像只是个roguelike模式，实际却不止于此（涉及剧透）[spoiler] ，暗线里隐藏着的剧情在不断的推进 [/spoiler]。

解谜环节的设计也是很有意思的，首先是与剧情融合的很好，只跑主线的话解谜环节会少很多，方便战斗爽的玩家。对于我这种想翻遍所有犄角旮旯的玩家，又安排了很多内容来给我去找。而且对于同一个谜题，解开的方式千奇百怪，比如一个上锁的房间，你可以从窗缝里面扔东西进去砸中房间内的开门按钮，力量等级高的战斗爽玩家也可以直接大力出奇迹徒手掰门，喜欢到处翻东西的玩家发现了那些记不住密码的员工贴在自己电脑背面的便签（以及电脑邮箱里面主管警告他把便签藏起来的邮件），黑客等级高的玩家可以尝试破解密码锁，（剧透）[spoiler] ，非人（乐）玩家可以去垃圾桶里找找，变成个小块的垃圾，纸团之类的，从窗缝滚进去 [/spoiler]等等。

总之Prey是我个人非常推荐的游戏，希望大家也能在这里面找到属于自己的快乐。

从来没玩过Arkane这个工作室的作品，比较有名的应该是耻辱系列了。和我对巫师3的评价一样，令人不痛快的游戏，必须大幅度作弊才能方便的做成就，在挣扎中通关。成就41/48，差了3个收集（其实差的不多了，真是无趣），4个另类的无技能，半技能树，全NPC击杀。
类型：
恐怖，解密探索收集，科幻，潜行（和我无关，就是干），沉浸式模拟（理解不了）
优点：
+气氛感优秀
+基本不开声音，有点吓人
+画面不错，视角流畅不晕
+故事挺棒
缺点：
---极差的地图便利性，为了所谓的沉浸感，连个传送功能没有，前所未有的恶心体验。
---没有地图UI，这么复杂的跑图需要不停的开菜单栏，要不就得背地图。而且任务设计需要来回往复在几个大地图穿梭，最后我都没打开心灵所的空气阀！一直按着shift在太空中跑，除了星球的美景，不知道有啥可看的。
---为了收集而收集，在恐怖氛围中潜行还得搜刮所有道具，玩家有体验感吗？安检站的功能就不能整合到玩家菜单里？？
---极差的成就设计，让玩家三周目可以，NPC击杀可是从头到尾啊，我见过最棒的还是魔兽世界，可追踪成就的完成进展，失败与否，具体道具拿到与否可以变色，恶心，虽然可以回档接着做，我都不感兴趣，地毯式房间搜刮，无趣！！！
--复杂的任务路线设计与空间挂钩，让游戏初始版本有大量BUG，除了最初玩魔兽世界，我很久没查游戏攻略需要不停的百度，看贴吧里的各种帖子了！！PSNINE，STEAM，游民，UCG杂志加起来都没提供大多数任务卡关点怎么解决！！上次挺烦人的还是玩无主之地2，卡各种空间。
-地图的开启特别依赖道具和技能，虽然方法很多，但是没有惊喜感，大量重复类型的破解谜题让人无语。
简单难度打起来也是挺不舒服的，修改了技能点，回血蓝护甲恐惧药，零件的数量，终于能痛快点的看剧情和找人，找东西了！！
截图中的碎碎念：
①很多任务都是没有功利性的，无关成就，我也不需要奖励，这个够天花板真是麻烦，但是为了清任务，还是做了。
②【寻宝任务】应该配一个成就，而且奖励是一个生产程序，不提示谁知道啊？

⑤伪结局的太空舱没提前看电脑，可以伸出舰桥，咱也不是大神，喷泡过去费了很大劲。

185166374.review:
It’s been 8 years since I bought Prey, and I finally gave it the proper chance it deserved. Back when I was in the Marine Corps, I was too hooked on League of Legends to really dive into it, and honestly, I probably chickened out when I first saw the Nightmare—a massive monster that freaked me out. But here I am, giving it another shot, and I’ve got some thoughts.  

The gameplay is fun and interactive. Gunplay? Solid. The difficulty though? Oh boy, it can get *really* frustrating at times. Don’t feel bad about lowering it—some enemies can 2-3 shot you, even on normal. The enemies themselves? Super repetitive and generic, which is a bit of a downer.  

The story wasn’t bad, and while the writing could’ve been better, it’s honestly way better than a lot of the junk modern games put out today. The most frustrating part for me was how much back-and-forth you have to do between areas. Too many locked doors, repetitive detours, and not enough clear direction at times—especially when side quests and main quests got mixed together. If they’d been more deliberate with guiding you, I think it would’ve been way more enjoyable.  

Arkane did a good job overall, but wow, they left in a lot of audio/visual bugs even after all these years. It’s kind of embarrassing, to be honest. Too late to fix now, but still a letdown.  

Final thoughts: I won’t be buying the DLC. The game was alright, and I don’t regret playing it, but it’s only slightly above average in my book. If it’s on sale and you’ve been thinking about it, go for it. **7.5/10.**

185149816.review:
The game has it's moments. Definitely promotes exploring as you won't be able to keep up with the difficulty increases without exploring and recycling everything to build more things, especially neuromods. But the combat just doesn't feel good. At all. You're kind of forced into using a bunch of gimmicks like prep'ing an enemy to take more damage and whatnot because prolonged fights are just bad news with the way the enemies behave. It all feels... clunky. 

If you make the mistake of hitting reload during a fight and want to switch weapons... nope. Full reload animation while something is charging you and you want to switch. 

Most enemies will just instantly hit you with something if you're close and you're forced into hiding. A lot. Most of the time it doesn't even matter because the enemies will clip through the walls and fire gigantic explosive projectiles at you anyway. 

The weapons don't really feel good to use most of the time. If your weapons aren't able to nearly 1 shot everything later on in the game with upgrades, you won't be getting anywhere. 

Yes there's many different ways to approach combat in this game (or not approach it rather). None of them really feel fun to do after the first 50 times against the same enemies and they just become incredibly annoying to fight later down the road.

185031377.review:
(While I only have a few hours on Steam, I have played this game extensively on both Xbox and Playstation. )

As someone who has loved "immersive sims" for decades - Deus Ex, System Shock, Thief, Dishonored, etc. - Prey might be the very best one. I've played Prey on Xbox, Playstation and PC, and it just gets better with age. 

Prey is a sci-fi thriller that combines a engaging slow-burn (in the best possible way) story, some of the best "play it your way" gameplay mechanics, and a hauntingly atmospheric setting. The blend of action, stealth, and RPG elements provides players with freedom to tackle challenges their own way, whether by using conventional - at least by sci-fin standards - weapons, Typhon powers, or hacking and sneaking their way across Talos I.

Prey received some negative high profile reviews at launch, but these were unfair at best, and outright libelous at worst. Game-breaking bugs and performance issues were sorted out long ago, and with modern hardware, this game really shines. Some might complain about the lack of enemy variety, but this is not a "run and gun" game - mowing down hordes of enemies isn't the point. It's about exploration, storytelling, freedom of play style, and a setting/atmosphere that is second to none. 

it's truly a shame that Arkane Austin was forced to follow Prey with the ill-conceived Redfall and was subsequently shuttered. But that doesn't take away from the brilliance of Prey. 

Do yourself a favor and play this underrated gem.

184966106.review:
Before anything else, I have to note that there's no way to turn off motion blur or mouse acceleration. The config file based methods documented online don't seem to work anymore - probably have been patched out by the devs.
Disgusting/10 don't waste your money on this, hope the devs have gone bankrupt.

If the above doesn't put you off, I don't have good news for you regarding the gameplay either.
It's nice and smooth and pretty and all, but the combat is a completely boring slog of a drag. And that's despite the AI displaying some genuine flashes of genius and even conveying a mild sense of personality via the behaviour of some of the creatures you're up against - well, specifically the mimics; the phantoms are pretty generic.
Elsewise it's a very by-the-book clone of System Shock, but with nothing to put up against the star of that game's show - Shodan.
So I'd recommend playing and probably replaying the magnificent System Shock remake before attempting the overall downgrade that this is - that thing's got the soul and magic that this sadly lacks.
And yes, I know the remake came out long after this title. But the remake is also extremely faithful to the original, which this is a blatant clone of, so I believe it a valid comparison.
If you always thought that it'd be really cool if System Shock were made by Eidos-Montreal teamed up with Ubisoft, and had an anaemic combat system, this might be right down your alley.
I find it kind of a bore though. Sad, cause the sci-fi itself's intriguing, and there's a bit of personality to the game otherwise too.
TL;DR a massive swing and a miss by a bunch of weird sadist devs.

184903549.review:
Solid game, if you could combine a Rubik's cube and a psych exam into a game. 
Pros.
-Good story with a good twist at the end.
-Nice graphics that still hold up
-Controls feel good as a FPS
-Flexible game play. You decide how to approach the game. There's often multiple way to achieve the same goal. Also how you build your character is up to you. 
-Requires real thinking. Common sense and out of the box thinking is needed which feels like a breath of fresh air. 
-For a game confined to one space station it feels large and very fun to explore. It feels like a sandbox should. 
-Multiple endings.

Cons
-Bugs, lots of bugs but nothing game breaking.
-While the game is beautiful with the crytec engine its still subject to some of the visual bugs we've come to associate with it. Still not game breaking.
-One thing I don't care for that this game does is encourage you to platform. This game hides goodies off path and require you to do so but this game doesn't do it well. It requires a bit of skill. If you're like me you explore to see how far you can push past the games boundaries so its no big but I can see it frustrating others. 
-Enemies can take a beating and resources are not abundant. I viewed this as a "Pro" but players that suck as micromanaging resources will have a problem real fast and the game never lets up as you advance. 

Conclusion
Great game if you're open to a challenge. Take your time, play it how you see fit and don't worry about your choices, right or wrong.

184801892.review:
Prey,  A Pérola que a Bethesda escondeu

A primeira vez que ouvi falar de Prey foi através do YouTube. Quando descobri do que se tratava, decidi não assistir a nenhuma série sobre o jogo para poder vivenciar a experiência por conta própria. Essa foi, sem dúvida, uma ótima decisão. Prey não só superou minhas expectativas como também se tornou meu jogo favorito da Bethesda.

Com uma pegada que lembra Fallout e Bioshock, Prey consegue manter sua própria identidade visual. Seu estilo futurista é único, e toda a ambientação espacial é impecavelmente construída. O visual dos cenários, personagens e criaturas é marcante, acompanhado de uma trilha sonora excelente que reforça a atmosfera de exploração no espaço.

A gameplay, é claro, é um dos grandes destaques do jogo. É super dinâmica e divertida, com uma grande variedade de armas à sua disposição. O jogo permite que você escolha o estilo de jogo que mais combina com você: desde sair atirando para todos os lados até adotar uma abordagem mais furtiva. Essa liberdade, somada à variedade de equipamentos e à necessidade de criar estratégias para superar cada situação, é uma das coisas que mais gostei. Além disso, a diversidade dos inimigos torna os combates ainda mais interessantes, já que cada um possui fraquezas ou resistências específicas, enriquecendo a experiência de jogo.

A história de Prey é fenomenal. Desde o início, o suspense cativa o jogador. A excelente dublagem ajuda a tornar as interações com NPCs ainda mais imersivas. Além disso, é muito divertido explorar os detalhes da narrativa por meio de áudios, textos ou pequenas nuances espalhadas pelo jogo. Cada NPC, cada item encontrado, possui um propósito, e explorar a estação espacial Talos I é incrivelmente satisfatório. O mundo do jogo parece realmente vivo.

Não consigo entender como Prey não teve o destaque que merece. Não entendo por que a Bethesda não conseguiu dar mais visibilidade a essa obra-prima. O jogo tem uma proposta incrível para quem ama títulos de survival no estilo de Fallout. É um prato cheio para fãs do gênero. Fica aqui minha recomendação dessa joia que a Bethesda infelizmente não soube como fazer brilhar.

184799527.review:
Начинал прохождение игры где-то на релизе на PC.
Но по какой-то причине, скипнул данный проект.

И вот, в 2024, было решено установить его на палубу и начать новый путь.

Я помню, что в свое время, игра не зашла аудитории, но 2024 был не богат на хорошие и качественные игры. 

Для меня Prey стал тем самым отложенным проектом, который имел, как оказалось отличное качество, по сравнению с новыми релизами. Завезли отличную оптимизацию, палуба тянет в 60 кадров легко и не напрягаясь (выставляю ограничение в 60FPS), даже не на полной мощности, графика, физика, отражения, все на хорошем уровне.

Сюжет игра подаёт в записках, звонках и сообщениях, [spoiler]иногда встреча с персонажами[/spoiler]), срендерными сцен нет от слова совсем, здесь все от первого лица и только ваш выбор и ваша внимательность.

Геймлей даёт на выбор несколько стилей и выбор который повлияет на концовку, правда она немного халтурная, но это не главное. 
А главное, это враги, мимики, фантомы и [spoiler]полтергейсты и кошмар (хотя он быстро выносится очередью в лицо)[/spoiler], каждый из них имеет свой стиль, они идеально проработаны и заставят вас думать перед вашей атакой. 
Мой совет, [spoiler]играйте со способностями мимика[/spoiler] и играйте в одно дыхание.

184666583.review:
I would only recommend this game on a heavy sale. 

Gameplay is, as others say, a mix between bioshock and dishonored. The combat loop is tedious after a while. The setting is amazing, and the art style is very cool. The story is good, not great, not terrible. Exploration was my favorite part, finding all the little nooks and crannies that i could, but the one thing that held this back for me from being great was the constant enemy spawning that made it so you had to fight your way back through every part of the game, of which you will have to backtrack often. I am not a master at stealth in video games normally, but stealth is practically impossible in this game so just avoid those skills and go for stuff to fight. I wasnt really satisfied by the ending I got, and the game feels like it plunges all the choices on you towards the ending instead of spreading them out. It feels pretty linear for most of the game, then at the end you get a whole bunch of different routes to choose and it feels very rushed. Upon looking up the other endings, I found that they all kind of suck though. I had already made up my mind by the end that I was not going to replay it, but the anticlimactic ending solidified that opinion.

TLDR: Setting is cool, story is mediocre, combat is tedious, exploration is held back by bad enemy mechanics, endings are not satisfying. overall 6/10. Will not be replaying.

184528356.review:
PREY es un juego que inicialmente abandoné tras 30 minutos, pero al darle una segunda oportunidad este año, me llevé una gran sorpresa. Es un immersive sim en toda regla, con múltiples posibilidades y un mapa que corresponde a una nave entera. Te familiarizas con cada rincón mientras exploras y te mantienes en constante tensión, ya que incluso un inocente taburete podría convertirse en un alien arranca-cabezas (mejor un taburete alien que un grupo de música).

La ambientación y la jugabilidad te meten de lleno en la nave, y la historia, con su capacidad de decisión y formas de resolver incluso en su multitud de misiones secundarias, me pareció muy interesante. Si tuviera que poner un "pero", sería lo limitado del arsenal (aunque quién necesita armas cuando vas a liarte a palos con una llave inglesa a cualquiera que se te cruce) y la dependencia de las grabaciones de sonido para avanzar en la trama, un recurso típico del género que nunca me ha convencido del todo.

184521243.review:
TLDR: a solid, semi-open world, almost-Metroidvania, almost-horror immersive sim that is great fun and features a very healthy dose of joy-of-discovery. (Oh, and, if it matters to you, it works flawlessly on the Steam Deck, right out of the box.)

Ignore my play time (about 12 hours at the time of writing this) - I played through the entire game on PS4 before picking it up here. (If I recall, this is a 30+ hour game if you do substantially all the side quests and such.) 

I thoroughly enjoyed my time with Prey (both my full playthrough on the PS4, and then my one-third playthrough so far on Steam). It starts off a bit daunting (i.e. you may feel a bit overwhelmed and under-equipped right out the gate), but once things start falling into place, the fun and the pacing kick into high-gear and are sustained throughout the rest of the game. 

Prey has a fantastic, lived-in setting full of lots of secrets (both in the form of items and lore) that reward thorough exploration. For the most part, it's not usually as scary as it tries to be, though it has its moments. The story (both the plot itself and the background stuff) is well-developed and intriguing. You can make yourself as OP or as meek as you'd like, and attempt to tackle most of the game guns blazing, sneaky sneaky, or anywhere on the spectrum in between.

All in all, Prey offers a great time that I'm happy to recommend if you're a fan of sci-fi (particularly of the space exploration and/or alien sub-genres), immersive sims, and/or open world games. If you want to play Dishonored in space (but with an open world instead of segmented missions), this is the game for you.

This is the thinking's man game. One of the best immersive sims ever made. In the intro you discover the cake is a lie and from that point they did not disappoint. I can easily see myself putting in over 100 hours only just to restart the game and do it again. I can see the sprinkles of Dishonored 2 mechanics in there, but this is a beast all its own. One of the best purchases I've made and I'm loving it. Getting this from any steam sale is a plus, but hell, I'd pay full  price for this. The fact that I got this for less than 10 bucks on a sale is a crime.

There is so much to do, so much to come back to, it's exactly what I'm looking for. You investigate an area, only to discover that there the path is blocked. You have several ways around this. Exploration is required, awareness is needed, and experimentation is encouraged. There are so many things you have to pay attention to in order to succeed it's amazing. The story is great as well and expertly crafted. Excellent use of scientific theory and concepts. Amazing. This is like poppa Dishonored and Dead space had a baby and their uncle was Bio shock, and the father actually came back with the milk. 10/10 masterpiece.

184399004.review:
[h1] Prey [/h1] 

Ein ganz schönes Brett an Spiel, mehr als ich anfänglich erwartet hatte. Das erkunden der Talos I Raumstation erinnert leicht an die ersten Bioshock Spiele. Mehrere Lösungswege für Probleme, angenehmes Skillsystem, tolles Gameplay - alles in Allem ein verdammt gutes Spiel. Ob im Angebot oder zum Vollpreis eine klare Empfehlung.

[h1] Story [/h1]
In der Rolle eines wahlweise männlichen oder weiblichen Morgan Yu, seines Zeichens Wissenschaftler, gilt es von der Talos I zu fliehen.

Man folgt einer Hauptgeschichte, hat abseits des Weges aber allerhand optionaler Nebenaufgaben welche Einfluss auf das Ende haben. Die Bedrohung ist eine Alienart, welche die Fähigkeit hat die Gestallt von Dingen anzunehmen. Andere Vertreter dieser Rasse gibt es natürlich auch. Was es genau mit dieser Alienart auf sich hat, ist Teil der Geschichte die es zu entdecken gilt.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]
Wie schon gesagt erinnert das Gameplay leicht an die alten Bioshock Spiele. Es stehen verschiedene Waffen, Werkzeuge und sogar Psi Fähigkeiten zur Auswahl, welche über ein RPG Skillsystem freigeschaltet werden. Über sogenannte Neuromods erweitert man seine Fähigkeiten. Diese werden in der Regel gefunden, können aber auch gebaut werden.

Nach und nach öffnen sich verschiedene Bereiche der Raumstation. Aber Vorsicht, zu viele Alienfähigkeiten verwirren die automatischen Geschütze, da diese dann nicht mehr ganz sicher sind ob man überhaupt noch menschlich ist.

Es wird geschlichen, geschossen, geklettert, gehackt und versteckt. Gefundene Sachen können recycelt werden. Mit erhaltenen Rohstoffen können an Fertigungsstationen Dinge gebaut werden. Baupläne vorausgesetzt.

Einen verschossenen Weg auf mehrere Arten dennoch begehen zu können war auch ein Element welches ich sehr mochte. Einen Lüftungsschacht finden, die Tür hacken oder mit Muskelkraft öffnen oder per Schaumkanone sich einfach einen neuen Weg bauen. Oder einfach Dinge übereinander stapelt und per normales springen seiner Wege gehen. Man entscheidet größtenteils selber welchen Weg man wann und wie geht. Für manche Türen allerdings benötigt man Zugangskarten welche man auf der ganzen Station finden kann und muss.

[h1] Fazit[/h1]
Da ich nichts zu bemängeln habe und ich auch keine technischen Probleme mit dem Spiel hatte, komme ich direkt zum Fazit.

Ja, auf jeden Fall eine klare Empfehlung. Ich habe ca. 40h gebraucht um das Ende zu sehen. 1-2h kann man abziehen wo ich das Spiel einfach nur an hatte als ich afk war. Habe aber fast alle Nebenaufgaben zumindest versucht zu erledigen, habe in fast alle Ecken geschaut und über die ganze Länge des Spiels durchgängig meine Freude daran gehabt, die Talos I zu erkunden und die Geschichte hinter den Ereignissen zu entschlüsseln.

Preis Leistungsverhältnis richtig richtig super. Das Spiel ist jeden Cent wert den man dafür ausgibt.

184206236.review:
We wagliù, Prey (gioco uscito il 5 maggio 2017 e sviluppato da arkane studios) è stat ingiustament sottovalutato. Infatti dopo che i capoccia di bethesda (per gli amici bathesda, bugthesda o bathosta) hanno deciso di mandare a casa il director Raphael Colantonio e di non sviluppare più un gioco immersive sim come conseguenza delle poche vendite del gioco, hanno ben deciso di: 
1) far sviluppare un titolo coop (wolfenstein youngblood) in collaborazione con machine games in meno di 2 anni di sviluppo e conseguentemente floppare un'altra volta (oltre che fare un titolo di merda). ✔
2) tagliare i fondi e il tempo di sviluppo di deathloop e farlo uscire buggato e con contenuti tagliati. ✔
3) sviluppare quello che in origine doveva essere un live service, poi trasformato e rattoppato all'ultimo creando un buon titolo per essesre uno dei peggiori giochi degli ultimi anni ( sia come estetica, come gameplay, meccaniche, trama, buggato come la merda ecc.). ✔
Purtroppo Prey è il penultimo (o ultimo) gioco di questi ragazzi che ha realmente cercato di dare qualcosa in più nel suo genere, ambienti curati e iper interagibili, tantissime strade e stronzate da poter fare o intraprendere per poter andare avanti, finali multipli, setting semplice ma appassionante, molteplici plot twists.
Cioè sto gioco ha tutto veramente tutto e invece di finanziare questi progetti, si punta a live service di merda o come piano di emergenza si fanno sviluppare giochi su licenza marvel/disney/lucas arts con la speranza di fare soldi con nomi di spicco.
Beh spero possano sentirsi contenti gli shareholders di bethesda e microsoft sapendo che venderanno le loro 2 copie e mezzo di indiana jones e l'antico cerchio mentre si siedono su una miriade di ip congelate in maniera indeterminata.
Comunque non mi reputo troppo pessimista, immagino che quando uscirà blade nel duemila venti boh ne venderano 4 di copie e potranno festeggiare i loro incredibili traguardi.
Complimenti, continuate così!!!!

[h1]СПРЕЙ[/h1]

ㅤТеперь стало понятно почему студия скопытилась. Пушто после Дизонорда, в котором были отличные уровни, которые можно было проходить вообще каким угодно стилем. Интересные способности, боевая система и общая иммерсивность с визуалом и вайбами антиутопии. Сюжет с персами хоть и не был чем-то выдающемся, но в любом случае не просидал. 
ㅤТак вот, играть в ЭТО просто пытка. Здесь же кроме знакомого визуального направления вообще ничего не осталось. Локации унылые и душные, их банально неинтересно проходить, постоянно непонятно куда идти, вечно какие-то тупые препятствия на пути и нескончаемый бубнешь в ухо. Нет выборов, вместо этого просто нудная дрочь по коридорам и затыкивание болванчиков с отравительной боевкой, которая не вызывает никаких эмоций, кроме негативных. В остальном все перегружено, как например стамина, убогий интерфейс или менеджмент инвентаря. Сюжет возможно и лучше, чем в Дизонорде, но какая разница, если геймплей калит, а проходить даже через силу уже невозможно. В добавок то, как показали нападение пришельцев вызывает только смех, наверно даже в детском мультике сделали бы лучше. 
ㅤКороче дроп, тупое гoвнo.

184112243.review:
Tengo mis luces y sombras con Prey. Me gusta lo que ofrece en conjunto, pero tampoco ha sido el juegazo que me esperaba.

Lo más fácil a destacar es la fantástica ambientación, se nota que han puesto mucho mimo en la creación de la Talos I, cada pasillo o sala que recorras te va a recrear la atmósfera perfecta entre terror y ciencia ficción aderezada con una banda sonora espectacular. Este es el punto fuerte del juego. 
Otro punto positivo son los enemigos, los cuales tienen unas habilidades bastante innovadoras que harán que pienses muy bien en como combatirlos para no quedarte sin balas (y sin vida).
Por último, antes de adentrarme en las cosas menos favorables del titulo quiero hacer hincapié en la historia, y es que aunque no sea una obra maestra, tiene lo suficiente como para mantenerte en vilo hasta los minutos finales.  Además, a veces nos pondrá en la tesitura de tomar elecciones nada agradables. En las cuales a veces tendremos que decidir si priorizar nuestros valores o nuestras necesidades. Y eso siempre gusta! :D

Pero luego están los "peros": Hay partes del juego que están pobremente explicadas, lo que va a inducir que no sepamos como actuar, o que tardemos mucho en como saber proceder. No es que sea del todo malo, ya que últimamente estamos mal acostumbrando a que hoy día nos lo den todo mascado. Pero sí que es verdad que para los que nos guste (por ejemplo) completar coleccionables nos pusiesen más en bandeja de qué tratan para ahorrarnos tiempo en volver a las primeras zonas jugables de la estación. Y es que este es el otro gran pero, el mapa es un laberinto en las cual es muy fácil perderse, si a eso le sumas las varias pantallas de carga que te vas a comer hace que acabe siendo un tostón llegar a la otra punta de la nave.
También me gustaría hacer mención al árbol de habilidades, el cual es muy completo, pero te piden tantos requisitos que para cuanto termines el juego con suerte habrás desbloqueado un 30%. Dejando atrás un sinfín de habilidades que hubiese gustado probar. Esto también pasa en Cyberpunk, pero ellos lo han implementado de una manera mucho más lógica. Con ramas separadas en cuanto al desarrollo de personaje que escojas. 
Y este sí con un poco de spoiler sobre el final: [spoiler] Da igual el camino que sigas, ya que el final siempre acaba de la misma manera, dejando la falsa sensación de que las elecciones han importado. [/spoiler]

Puntuación: 7,5
Conclusión: El juego me ha gustado, pero también es verdad que alguna vez llegué a pensar en si abandonarlo porque no me lo estaba pasando bien, y es que es un poco frustrante si no entiendes algunas mecánicas que te ayudarán mucho en la lucha contra los enemigos. Pero una vez solventado esto, la verdad es que no podía parar. Lo recomiendo bastante si te gustan los singleplayer atmosféricos con toques de terror. (y mucho más si esta a 3€ como en el momento que escribo esta reseña!)

Prey to fantastyczna produkcja. Niespodziewanie głęboki dramat poruszający ciekawą problematykę kontaktu ludzkości z czymś nieznanym, człowieczej moralności i empatii ornamentowany dozą kosmicznego horroru. Jak i zarazem historia szkatułkowa pełna mikro opowieści i postaci ze swoimi charakterami, problemami i motywami. Gra pełna mnogości mechanik, które są intuicyjne, fajne i co najważniejsze - różnorodne, w której każdy napotkany problem możemy rozwiązać na inny sposób, za pomocą różnych narzędzi i taktyk, a mówiąc jeszcze inaczej - prawdziwy immersive sim. I do tego świetnie prezentujący się audiowizualnie (zauroczyło mnie to połączenie art deco, realizmu socjalistycznego i retrofuturyzmu w stylu Obcego). 

Prey to też kompetentna fantastyka, która nie tyle co inspiruje się sferą naukową i kulturową naszego świata, a przekształca i rozwija istniejące już nurty i teorie naukowe, by stworzyć coś wprawdzie unikatowego.

184013893.review:
Prey Recipe

Ingredients:
1 part gripping sci-fi narrative
2 cups of atmospheric tension and suspense
A generous serving of immersive exploration
A dash of inventive gameplay mechanics
A sprinkle of resource management and crafting
A hint of stunning visuals and sound design

Directions:
Preheat your excitement by diving into the gripping sci-fi narrative of Prey. The story is filled with twists and turns that keep you on the edge of your seat, blending mystery, danger, and intrigue seamlessly.

Combine the atmospheric tension and suspense. The eerie environment of Talos I space station creates a sense of constant unease, where danger lurks around every corner.

Mix in the immersive exploration. The meticulously designed environments encourage thorough investigation, rewarding players with hidden secrets and detailed world-building.

Fold in the inventive gameplay mechanics. Use the unique abilities granted by neuromods to tackle challenges in multiple ways, offering a high level of creativity and strategic planning.

Sprinkle with resource management and crafting. Scavenge the environment for materials to craft tools and weapons, adding depth to the gameplay and ensuring you're always prepared for what's next.

Add a hint of stunning visuals and sound design. The graphics and immersive soundscapes enhance the overall experience, drawing you deeper into the unsettling world of Talos I.

Tasting Notes:
Best enjoyed by fans of sci-fi, survival horror, and immersive sims. Pairs well with a dark room, surround sound, and a strong sense of curiosity.
The narrative and atmosphere create an intense and captivating experience. The gameplay mechanics offer a high degree of flexibility and creativity, keeping the game engaging and fresh.

Bon appétit!

Splendid game and expierience! For those who are obsessed with space, science fiction, and games like Stalker or Alien isolation (I can say that Prey is inspired by these), this game is worth to try. the physics is absolutely great, just like the story. The game requires attentiveness and carful observation of your sorroundings. There is a lot of hiding story behind the main story line. I truly like the fact, there is lack of ammu so you have to think about another way to survive than shooting (and there is a lot of smart options to do so). After all its not Doom.  

Of course there are also some  disadvantages...
First, the main story line is not very long. Not short, but I got a feeling like I lacked some additional opportiunity for combat or explore. Expacially that in the game itself are few rooms which could have some additional content or story.

183916159.review:
It's a great game until you reach the Shuttle Bay, then it really starts to show that's it not very polished and no longer the BioShock standard you held it to in the beginning of the game. It's more like BioShock and Dishonored were cousins and this was their slightly retarted baby. I mean, you still love it but you know there's something wrong with it.

The reason I say Shuttle Bay is that when the real annoying bugs started showing and you'll wish they'd wrap up the story already. Mostly to be rid of these fucking loading screens when the game is constantly pushing you to go from point A to point B, but first passing through point C, D and E to get there.

Don't get me wrong, the game is great. But it's not amazing. It took me about 40 hours but I explored every corner of that station and even then I still didn't find everything so that's telling. Flying around in space is also brilliant, even with wonky controls.

The story is decent, it starts great. Lots of exploring, theories and stuff to read/listen to that slowly explain what the fuck is going on Rapture in space. The View Mirrors are such a cool fucking gimmick, especially when they reveal codes/secrets, but feel a bit underused. Sadly, the endings are a bit lackluster. Apart from a brief 10 second cutscene, the endings boil down to the same thing.

Gameplay is sort of like BioShock, one hand shoots, the other hand rubs out a plasmid. It's not the best shooting experience but you can always sneak around and find other ways. Sadly, sneaking is a bit clunky as you tend to get stuck on quite a lot of shit and enemies catch you fairly quickly. Game becomes quite easy once the guns are upgraded and you learn how to fight each type. The crafting is in my opinion also brilliant. Yes it's slow but it feels like it belongs and it's actually quite cleverly thought out.

In the end, it's definitely worth to experience it. If you loved BioShock (like me) then you'll get immersed and enjoy the ride, even though you'll curse at stupid shit like unable to swap weapons when the (super fucking slow) reload animation already started, stupid bugs and those god awefull loading screens.

Solid 8,5/10. It's a brilliant game that could of been even more brilliant with some better combat and a more fleshed out story/ending. Also for the price, it's a nobrainer.

This is one of my favorite games of all time. It truly is one of a kind, and I wish there are more like it.

-If you are up for a challenge, like to explore, do puzzles, don't mind survival aspects of it and don't mind horror-like atmosphere (though it's not a horror really, at least I don't play horror games) I couldn't recommend this game more.

-It's hard to put this game inside any box. It is truly up to you and your to define it's genre. Weird thing to say, but at moments it feels like Fallout, BioShock, Half-Life... and at moments it is like f-ing Minecraft... 

-There is a lot of envirovemental puzzles, and a lot of ways to solve them, which can make you feel pretty smart. It feels like Devs have thought about everything.

-There is variety of enemies you face, each have their own weaknesses, you need to research them, think before getting into combat, or trying to avoid it.

-Your choices truly matter. How you approach enemies, how you build your talent tree (this one especially), which side objectives you take (even the ones you miss, it still counts)...

-Story is unique. Pretty misterious and it unfolds itself nicely. With a lot of side objectives through which you can discover lore of the game. I wont go into details not to spoil anything, but there definitely are a lot of moments to remember.

-Even for a 7 year old game... it is still beautiful. Level design is amazing. The world you explore really feels alive, and there is sooo much details everywhere. Overall style is... well imagine Great Getsby in space...

183828033.review:
9分！非常推荐的佳作！
我是一周目【梦魇】难度通关，前期先点了黑客、维修这类技能，结果被暴打，中期把背包容量、材料拾取以及战斗技能点起来后轻松过。
这款游戏在国内的人气真的很低，以至于想在B站找个攻略，都没几个人做。我也是听说它是《死亡空间》的代餐，所以才顺便来玩玩，结果发现意外的不错。
跟《死亡空间》类似，故事发生在太空中的一个空间站，你可以在空间站的不同区域来回穿梭，感受热情好客的外星居民带给你的浓浓的“生活气息”。半开放世界的设计也让空间站充满了探索感，你可能搜着搜着就突然解锁一个支线，实在找不到还有员工追踪功能让你逐个找齐，这简直是收集党的福音。
但这里制作组其实藏了一手，开头让玩家以为自己只是个每天两点一线普普通通的社畜，当玩家打碎镜子，发现自己其实身处在一个《楚门的世界》，甚至不是在地球上，那种震撼是无与伦比的。
而随着剧情的进展，玩家所做的一切事情都会被悄悄记录下来，在最后揭露玩家真实身份时，作为最终对你个人结局的评判。以此整个游戏过程中，你所救的每个人，做的每条支线，在支线中所做出的选择，甚至是装不装变异技能，都变得意义重大。
再说说战斗系统，开头给的那把水泥枪设计得很有创意，既可以封住敌人，又能拿来做楼梯，跟《死亡空间》的切割枪有异曲同工之妙。但这个一枪多用的创意并没有延续下去，中后期开始就变成纯粹的打枪游戏。这是一个不太好的地方。
另外一个不太好的地方是敌人的弱点系统也做得很迷，比如【技术魔】有一个弱点是【电磁脉冲手雷】，但其实【技术魔】本身根本不吃这玩意，【电磁脉冲手雷】只能打掉吸附在它身上的炮台。还有很多怪的弱点是【灵能】，理论上是所有变异技能都有效果，但实际体验下来还不如用枪杀的快。
还有【梦魇怪】这个设计，只能说是毁誉参半的设计，它前期给人带来的压迫感是毋庸置疑的，但会堵门堵电梯就有点恶心了，下电梯的时候是有小段时间不能操作的，这个时间足以让它把你秒杀掉，于是你只能在电梯前眼巴巴吧地等两分钟，而中后期伤害上来之后，又沦为随便踩死的路边一只蟑螂，感觉没有达到设计意图。
最后是恐怖氛围塑造方面比较一般，前期也就靠变形怪突然跳脸吓你一跳，中期开始就没什么活了，玩家伤害也起来了，基本就开始横行霸道了。
不过这些都是小问题，游戏作为一款FPS游戏，总体给人的体验还是很流畅的，特别是当你救了所有人，清完所有支线，评委们全票为你转身的时候，那种感觉真的很棒。

183714314.review:
I haven't finished this game yet, I bought it back in 2017 and thought it looked neat, so I got it and started playing it.  Not the type of game I normally play since I usually play games that quite LITERALLY give you everything on a silver platter, a bit exaggerated, but you get me.   Thing is with Prey is you're not told anything, you literally don't have a clue on what to do.  The game starts you off in a apartment building, and your told you have a 9 am appointment in the testing lab.  Reading your emails provided by your brother and the staff, you're to get ready and get on the helicopter, and meet your brother for the testing.

Upon meeting your brother you're told to get in the testing area, and begin testing.  The testing doesn't take long and an unusual thing happens.  A so called, "Mimic", mimics Bellamy's coffee mug and kills him, and upon witnessing this, you're sedated and magically you wake back up in your apartment, in bed once again. Come to find out from said emails, you're NOT safe, you MUST escape your building which turns out, it was just a simulation!

    Skipping the story the game like I said, doesn't tell you where to go, you're forced to read emails and figure out what to do.  It's not the kind of game to hold your hand and say go here, you MUST read!  I for one do not like reading so, this is a hard one for me to play through, as I stopped playing the game due to not enjoying how the game DOESN'T hold your hand!  Yeah, I'm used to games do it all for me, lol!  I mean, a lot of games I've played just tell me what to do.  

Now if you want to run guns blazing, you can't.  This game isn't your typical average shooter game, it's got like that Resident Evil vibe to the guns, in a way not totally.  Ammo is scarce, so use it wisely, and Health kits are too.  You can though craft ammo and health kits, but you NEED a blueprint for said item to craft, or else you can't craft it.  Which is WHY exploration is a HUGE thing in this game! Explore your surroundings!  Some people don't like exploring, they find it boring.  

For enemies to know HOW to defeat them, you need a Psychoscope, which this allows you to find out its weaknesses, plus allowing you to craft Typhon based Neuromods, which in that case allows you to basically BECOME the alien!  You get their powers by researching them with the Psychoscope.  Also, you will have to strategize how you defeat an enemy, cause they HURT!  They're very powerful and you're NOT!  Use the environment for example, there's plenty of things to use to kill your enemies, not just your guns.

   Prey is an Immersive Survival Horror game, that tests you on what you're capable of, and how to overcome certain situations and obstacles.  The game may tell you what you should do next, but only by reading emails and finding clues, will you then get side objectives.   The map shows where your next objective is, but how to get there is totally up to you, it will NOT tell you how to get there, figure it out!    

Prey 2017 wasn't supposed to be the next game to come out, Prey 2 was supposed to be coming out, but Bethesda told Arcane studios, "Hey, Prey 2 just doesn't match up to what OUR standards are, and you need to scrap this game and just make Prey", which Prey 2017 wasn't even supposed to have that name.   The name Prey for Prey 2017 was ripped straight from the original game, "Prey 2006", and just had that name slapped onto the new game.  And this bigger thing, Prey 2017 is a reboot from Prey 2006, and the game has NOTHING to do with Prey 2006.  But, I'm pretty sure Prey 2017 does have some hints to the original game, I could be wrong though.

If you like games that don't hold your hand like a toddler, that doesn't know how to walk, you may or may not like Prey 2017.  Thing is, Prey 2017 was poorly advertised, so its recognition went out the window, and so reviewers like IGN gave it a freaking 4 score! Don't listen to IGN, they literally give good games poor scores, and so Prey 2017 never got noticed, and its sales were VERY low!  So low, that gamers refused to buy Prey 2017 and that hurt the sales even more. 

    Like I said, I haven't finished the game yet, but if I were you, give it a go, you may find something you like.

Best immersive sim ever despite it's flaws, if you liked system shock, bioshock, or deus ex, PLAY THIS GAME. It's a tragedy more people haven't played it. Completely ignore the name Prey, pretend the title is "Neuro Shock" or "Typhon Shock".

Both the main game and the DLC are weird in that they initially repel players with an annoying difficulty curve and lame early game combat, but once you get past that everything just clicks and comes together beautifully. The game becomes unbelievably fun, there are so many different ways to play it and tackle the obstacles. I would honestly spend a full $60, but it's a steal on sale, zero excuse not to get it.

Mooncrash is an incredible DLC, they greatly improved the feel of movement with the suit booster dash and added a really neat melee weapon and some new skills. I really really wish these were all in the main game, extremely fun. The permadeath rouge-like elements and the RNG were initially a turn-off, but I ended up dumping tons of hours into it. Really cool idea and execution, truly one of a kind.

Overall 10/10 - a buggy flawed masterpiece that will never get a sequel, thanks Todd Howard and Microsoft

Potentially great game but variety of issues put this into not recommend for me. 

Overall: 5/10
Bland Gun-play, Psychic system UI makes it awful to use
Enemies are surprisingly generic
Writing is generic or worse
Sound design is atrocious. Sound frequently breaks and can't be fixed.
Fuck whoever wrote the after credits scene. Ruined the game. 

Gun play was fun but limited. Not a lot of difference in weapons, it's really just shotgun or electric gun, nothing else has enough ammo or does damage fast enough to matter. Would have loved a flamethrower, laser gun (the Q-Beam sucks), or military weapons like a rifle or grenade launcher. The grenades were neat as was the gloo gun but everything else was boilerplate. 

Psychic powers requiring a helmet that partially deafens and reduces your vision was an awful design choice. The powers are also hard to aim even after taking into account the vision issues. By about a 1/3 of the game I stopped using them entirely. 

The characters drone on and on. Would love to be able to skip them. Would REALLY love to skip audio logs because any time you accidentally press L one plays. It's actually faster to quick save and quick load than to listen to more of the drivel. Enemy sound design was really bad since it only mattered when they were already on you. You couldn't use sound to scout an area, once an enemy made a sound it had either detected you or attacked you. 

The station itself was really neat. Well-designed, intuitive layout, looked interesting and lived in even if it was no more diverse than Bioshock was however many years before. 

The lack of bosses was really odd. Especially when you can one tap the only 'evil guy' in the game. And the final boss is essentially just an environmental effect like fire? What? 

The evil guy also has a sequence break issue that prevents you from getting the good ending. Poor QA to have an issue so obvious with no fixes for it. 

The 'it was all a dream' after credits ending really ruined the game though. Fuck whoever wrote that. Please never write again. Not even a birthday card. You suck.

I love everything about this game, but by far my favorite thing is the lore. I love reading all the messages left by former employees and hearing about all their stories, and having it all make sense and come together. I love seeing how the environment tells a story about how they died or how they lived on talos l. The grand lobby and the tiny living quarters contrast showing how corrupt this place is before even knowing what’s directly stated to us. People often say the story lacks in prey which I can understand, at surface level the story we experience isn’t anything extraordinary. But they’re missing the other half of the story that’s riddled throughout the station. 

This game is SO immersive. EVERY SINGLE PART of the station is explorable. Not only that but all of it adds up together. The interior perfectly matches up with the exterior, I don’t need to explain how impressive that is, right? Every employee is accounted for, everyone supposed to be on Talos IS and it’s so cool. The amount of love put into this game is extraordinary. You can really feel it while playing.
